Physical Exam: Neurological examination: including assessment of mental status, cranial nerves, motor function, reflexes, and sensation.
Justification: To assess for any signs of neurological impairment or focal deficits.

Physical Exam: General examination: including vital signs (temperature, pulse, respiration, blood pressure), head-to-toe assessment, and examination of the skin, ears, nose, throat, and lymph nodes.
Justification: To assess for any signs of infection or inflammation.
